intro: Tylophora lui, commonly known as the Chinese star vine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by spherical, woody fruits containing several seeds. Tylophora lui is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. It has been used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
